trans-unit.source: Manage and monitor Azure virtual machine backups | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage and monitor Azure virtual machine backups | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage and monitor an Azure virtual machine backups
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage and monitor an Azure virtual machine backups

trans-unit.source: Manage and monitor Azure virtual machine backups
trans-unit.target: Manage and monitor Azure virtual machine backups

trans-unit.source: Manage protected virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Manage protected virtual machines

trans-unit.source: To manage protected virtual machines:
trans-unit.target: To manage protected virtual machines:

trans-unit.source: To view and manage backup settings for a virtual machine click the **Protected Items** tab.
trans-unit.target: To view and manage backup settings for a virtual machine click the **Protected Items** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click on the name of a protected item to see the **Backup Details** tab, which shows you information about the last backup.
trans-unit.target: Click on the name of a protected item to see the **Backup Details** tab, which shows you information about the last backup.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine backup
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine backup

trans-unit.source: To view and manage backup policy settings for a virtual machine click the **Policies** tab.
trans-unit.target: To view and manage backup policy settings for a virtual machine click the **Policies** tab.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine policy
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine policy

trans-unit.source: The **Backup Policies** tab shows you the existing policy.
trans-unit.target: The **Backup Policies** tab shows you the existing policy.

trans-unit.source: You can modify as needed.
trans-unit.target: You can modify as needed.

trans-unit.source: If you need to create a new policy click **Create** on the **Policies** page.
trans-unit.target: If you need to create a new policy click **Create** on the **Policies** page.

trans-unit.source: Note that if you want to remove a policy it shouldn't have any virtual machines associated with it.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you want to remove a policy it shouldn't have any virtual machines associated with it.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine policy
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine policy

trans-unit.source: You can get more information about actions or status for a virtual machine on the **Jobs** page.
trans-unit.target: You can get more information about actions or status for a virtual machine on the **Jobs** page.

trans-unit.source: Click a job in the list to get more details, or filter jobs for a specific virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click a job in the list to get more details, or filter jobs for a specific virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Jobs
trans-unit.target: Jobs

trans-unit.source: On-demand backup of a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: On-demand backup of a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: You can take an on-demand backup of a virtual machine once it is configured for protection.
trans-unit.target: You can take an on-demand backup of a virtual machine once it is configured for protection.

trans-unit.source: If the initial backup is pending for the virtual machine, on-demand backup will create a full copy of the virtual machine in Azure backup vault.
trans-unit.target: If the initial backup is pending for the virtual machine, on-demand backup will create a full copy of the virtual machine in Azure backup vault.

trans-unit.source: If first backup is completed, on-demand backup will only send changes from previous backup to Azure backup vault.
trans-unit.target: If first backup is completed, on-demand backup will only send changes from previous backup to Azure backup vault.

trans-unit.source: To take an on-demand backup of a virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: To take an on-demand backup of a virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the **Protected Items** page and select **Azure Virtual Machine** as **Type** (if not already selected) and click on **Select** button.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the **Protected Items** page and select **Azure Virtual Machine** as **Type** (if not already selected) and click on **Select** button.

trans-unit.source: VM Type
trans-unit.target: VM Type

trans-unit.source: Select the virtual machine on which you want to take an on-demand backup and click on **Backup Now** button at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Select the virtual machine on which you want to take an on-demand backup and click on **Backup Now** button at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Back up now
trans-unit.target: Back up now

trans-unit.source: This will create a backup job on the selected virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This will create a backup job on the selected virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Retention range of recovery point created through this job will be same as that specified in the policy associated with the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Retention range of recovery point created through this job will be same as that specified in the policy associated with the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Creating backup job
trans-unit.target: Creating backup job

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To view the policy associated with a virtual machine, drill down into virtual machine in the **Protected Items** page and go to backup policy tab.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To view the policy associated with a virtual machine, drill down into virtual machine in the **Protected Items** page and go to backup policy tab.

trans-unit.source: Once the job is created, you can click on **View job** button in the toast bar to see the corresponding job in the jobs page.
trans-unit.target: Once the job is created, you can click on **View job** button in the toast bar to see the corresponding job in the jobs page.

trans-unit.source: Backup job created
trans-unit.target: Backup job created

trans-unit.source: After successful completion of the job, a recovery point will be created which you can use to restore the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: After successful completion of the job, a recovery point will be created which you can use to restore the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This will also increment the recovery point column value by 1 in **Protected Items** page.
trans-unit.target: This will also increment the recovery point column value by 1 in **Protected Items** page.

trans-unit.source: Stop protecting virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Stop protecting virtual machines

trans-unit.source: You can choose to stop the future backups of a virtual machine with the following options:
trans-unit.target: You can choose to stop the future backups of a virtual machine with the following options:

trans-unit.source: Retain backup data associated with virtual machine in Azure Backup vault
trans-unit.target: Retain backup data associated with virtual machine in Azure Backup vault

trans-unit.source: Delete backup data associated with virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Delete backup data associated with virtual machine

trans-unit.source: If you have selected to retain backup data associated with virtual machine, you can use the backup data to restore the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you have selected to retain backup data associated with virtual machine, you can use the backup data to restore the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For pricing details for such virtual machines, click [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/backup/).
trans-unit.target: For pricing details for such virtual machines, click [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/backup/).

trans-unit.source: To Stop protection for a virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: To Stop protection for a virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Protected Items** page and select **Azure virtual machine** as the filter type (if not already selected) and click on **Select** button.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Protected Items** page and select **Azure virtual machine** as the filter type (if not already selected) and click on **Select** button.

trans-unit.source: VM Type
trans-unit.target: VM Type

trans-unit.source: Select the virtual machine and click on **Stop Protection** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Select the virtual machine and click on **Stop Protection** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Stop protection
trans-unit.target: Stop protection

trans-unit.source: By default, Azure Backup doesn’t delete the backup data associated with the Virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: By default, Azure Backup doesn’t delete the backup data associated with the Virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Confirm stop protection
trans-unit.target: Confirm stop protection

trans-unit.source: If you want to delete backup data, select the check box.
trans-unit.target: If you want to delete backup data, select the check box.

trans-unit.source: Checkbox
trans-unit.target: Checkbox

trans-unit.source: Please select a reason for stopping the backup.
trans-unit.target: Please select a reason for stopping the backup.

trans-unit.source: While this is optional, providing a reason will help Azure Backup to work on the feedback and prioritize the customer scenarios.
trans-unit.target: While this is optional, providing a reason will help Azure Backup to work on the feedback and prioritize the customer scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Submit** button to submit the **Stop protection** job.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Submit** button to submit the **Stop protection** job.

trans-unit.source: Click on **View Job** to see the corresponding the job in **Jobs** page.
trans-unit.target: Click on **View Job** to see the corresponding the job in **Jobs** page.

trans-unit.source: Stop protection
trans-unit.target: Stop protection

trans-unit.source: If you have not selected **Delete associated backup data** option during **Stop Protection** wizard, then post job completion, protection status changes to **Protection Stopped**.
trans-unit.target: If you have not selected **Delete associated backup data** option during **Stop Protection** wizard, then post job completion, protection status changes to **Protection Stopped**.

trans-unit.source: The data remains with Azure Backup until it is explicitly deleted.
trans-unit.target: The data remains with Azure Backup until it is explicitly deleted.

trans-unit.source: You can always delete the data by selecting the virtual machine in the **Protected Items** page and clicking **Delete**.
trans-unit.target: You can always delete the data by selecting the virtual machine in the **Protected Items** page and clicking **Delete**.

trans-unit.source: Stopped protection
trans-unit.target: Stopped protection

trans-unit.source: If you have selected the **Delete associated backup data** option, the virtual machine won’t be part of the **Protected Items** page.
trans-unit.target: If you have selected the **Delete associated backup data** option, the virtual machine won’t be part of the **Protected Items** page.

trans-unit.source: Re-protect Virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Re-protect Virtual machine

trans-unit.source: If you have not selected the **Delete associate backup data** option in **Stop Protection**, you can re-protect the virtual machine by following the steps similar to backing up registered virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: If you have not selected the **Delete associate backup data** option in **Stop Protection**, you can re-protect the virtual machine by following the steps similar to backing up registered virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Once protected, this virtual machine will have backup data retained prior to stop protection and recovery points created after re-protect.
trans-unit.target: Once protected, this virtual machine will have backup data retained prior to stop protection and recovery points created after re-protect.

trans-unit.source: After re-protect, the virtual machine’s protection status will be changed to **Protected** if there are recovery points prior to **Stop Protection**.
trans-unit.target: After re-protect, the virtual machine’s protection status will be changed to **Protected** if there are recovery points prior to **Stop Protection**.

trans-unit.source: Reprotected VM
trans-unit.target: Reprotected VM

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When re-protecting the virtual machine, you can choose a different policy than the policy with which virtual machine was protected initially.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When re-protecting the virtual machine, you can choose a different policy than the policy with which virtual machine was protected initially.

trans-unit.source: Unregister virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Unregister virtual machines

trans-unit.source: If you want to remove the virtual machine from the backup vault:
trans-unit.target: If you want to remove the virtual machine from the backup vault:

trans-unit.source: Click on the **UNREGISTER** button at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **UNREGISTER** button at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Disable protection
trans-unit.target: Disable protection

trans-unit.source: A toast notification will appear at the bottom of the screen requesting confirmation.
trans-unit.target: A toast notification will appear at the bottom of the screen requesting confirmation.

trans-unit.source: Click **YES** to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click **YES** to continue.

trans-unit.source: Disable protection
trans-unit.target: Disable protection

trans-unit.source: Delete Backup data
trans-unit.target: Delete Backup data

trans-unit.source: You can delete the backup data associated with a virtual machine, either:
trans-unit.target: You can delete the backup data associated with a virtual machine, either:

trans-unit.source: During Stop Protection Job
trans-unit.target: During Stop Protection Job

trans-unit.source: After a stop protection job is completed on a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: After a stop protection job is completed on a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: To delete backup data on a virtual machine, which is in the *Protection Stopped* state post successful completion of a **Stop Backup** job:
trans-unit.target: To delete backup data on a virtual machine, which is in the *Protection Stopped* state post successful completion of a **Stop Backup** job:

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the **Protected Items** page and select **Azure Virtual Machine** as *type* and click the **Select** button.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the **Protected Items** page and select **Azure Virtual Machine** as *type* and click the **Select** button.

trans-unit.source: VM Type
trans-unit.target: VM Type

trans-unit.source: Select the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Select the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine will be in **Protection Stopped** state.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine will be in **Protection Stopped** state.

trans-unit.source: Protection stopped
trans-unit.target: Protection stopped

trans-unit.source: Click the **DELETE** button at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click the **DELETE** button at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Delete backup
trans-unit.target: Delete backup

trans-unit.source: In the **Delete backup data** wizard, select a reason for deleting backup data (highly recommended) and click **Submit**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Delete backup data** wizard, select a reason for deleting backup data (highly recommended) and click **Submit**.

trans-unit.source: Delete backup data
trans-unit.target: Delete backup data

trans-unit.source: This will create a job to delete backup data of selected virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This will create a job to delete backup data of selected virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click **View job** to see corresponding job in Jobs page.
trans-unit.target: Click **View job** to see corresponding job in Jobs page.

trans-unit.source: Data deletion successful
trans-unit.target: Data deletion successful

trans-unit.source: Once the job is completed, the entry corresponding to the virtual machine will be removed from **Protected items** page.
trans-unit.target: Once the job is completed, the entry corresponding to the virtual machine will be removed from **Protected items** page.

trans-unit.source: Dashboard
trans-unit.target: Dashboard

trans-unit.source: On the **Dashboard** page you can review information about Azure virtual machines, their storage, and jobs associated with them in the last 24 hours.
trans-unit.target: On the **Dashboard** page you can review information about Azure virtual machines, their storage, and jobs associated with them in the last 24 hours.

trans-unit.source: You can view backup status and any associated backup errors.
trans-unit.target: You can view backup status and any associated backup errors.

trans-unit.source: Dashboard
trans-unit.target: Dashboard

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Values in the dashboard are refreshed once every 24 hours.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Values in the dashboard are refreshed once every 24 hours.

trans-unit.source: Auditing Operations
trans-unit.target: Auditing Operations

trans-unit.source: Azure backup provides review of the "operation logs" of backup operations triggered by the customer making it easy to see exactly what management operations were performed on the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: Azure backup provides review of the "operation logs" of backup operations triggered by the customer making it easy to see exactly what management operations were performed on the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Operations logs enable great post-mortem and audit support for the backup operations.
trans-unit.target: Operations logs enable great post-mortem and audit support for the backup operations.

trans-unit.source: The following operations are logged in Operation logs:
trans-unit.target: The following operations are logged in Operation logs:

trans-unit.source: Register
trans-unit.target: Register

trans-unit.source: Unregister
trans-unit.target: Unregister

trans-unit.source: Configure protection
trans-unit.target: Configure protection

trans-unit.source: Backup ( Both scheduled as well as on-demand backup through BackupNow)
trans-unit.target: Backup ( Both scheduled as well as on-demand backup through BackupNow)

trans-unit.source: Restore
trans-unit.target: Restore

trans-unit.source: Stop protection
trans-unit.target: Stop protection

trans-unit.source: Delete backup data
trans-unit.target: Delete backup data

trans-unit.source: Add policy
trans-unit.target: Add policy

trans-unit.source: Delete policy
trans-unit.target: Delete policy

trans-unit.source: Update policy
trans-unit.target: Update policy

trans-unit.source: Cancel job
trans-unit.target: Cancel job

trans-unit.source: To view operation logs corresponding to a backup vault:
trans-unit.target: To view operation logs corresponding to a backup vault:

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Management services** in Azure portal, and then click the **Operation Logs** tab.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Management services** in Azure portal, and then click the **Operation Logs** tab.

trans-unit.source: Operation Logs
trans-unit.target: Operation Logs

trans-unit.source: In the filters, select **Backup** as *Type* and specify the backup vault name in *service name* and click on **Submit**.
trans-unit.target: In the filters, select **Backup** as *Type* and specify the backup vault name in *service name* and click on **Submit**.

trans-unit.source: Operation Logs Filter
trans-unit.target: Operation Logs Filter

trans-unit.source: In the operations logs, select any operation and click **Details** to see details corresponding to an operation.
trans-unit.target: In the operations logs, select any operation and click **Details** to see details corresponding to an operation.

trans-unit.source: Operation Logs-Fetching details
trans-unit.target: Operation Logs-Fetching details

trans-unit.source: The **Details wizard** contains information about the operation triggered, job Id, resource on which this operation is triggered, and start time of the operation.
trans-unit.target: The **Details wizard** contains information about the operation triggered, job Id, resource on which this operation is triggered, and start time of the operation.

trans-unit.source: Operation Details
trans-unit.target: Operation Details

trans-unit.source: Alert notifications
trans-unit.target: Alert notifications

trans-unit.source: You can get custom alert notifications for the jobs in portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get custom alert notifications for the jobs in portal.

trans-unit.source: This is achieved by defining PowerShell based alert rules on operational logs events.
trans-unit.target: This is achieved by defining PowerShell based alert rules on operational logs events.

trans-unit.source: Event based alerts work in Azure resource mode.
trans-unit.target: Event based alerts work in Azure resource mode.

trans-unit.source: Switch to Azure Resource mode by executing following cmdlet in elevated command mode:
trans-unit.target: Switch to Azure Resource mode by executing following cmdlet in elevated command mode:

trans-unit.source: To define a custom notification to alert for backup failures, a sample command will look like:
trans-unit.target: To define a custom notification to alert for backup failures, a sample command will look like:

trans-unit.source: **ResourceId**: You can get this from Operations Logs popup as described in above section.
trans-unit.target: **ResourceId**: You can get this from Operations Logs popup as described in above section.

trans-unit.source: ResourceUri in details popup window of an operation is the ResourceId to besupplied for this cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: ResourceUri in details popup window of an operation is the ResourceId to besupplied for this cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: **EventName**: For alerts on IaaS VM backup, supported values are - Register,Unregister,ConfigureProtection,Backup,Restore,StopProtection,DeleteBackupData,CreateProtectionPolicy,DeleteProtectionPolicy,UpdateProtectionPolicy
trans-unit.target: **EventName**: For alerts on IaaS VM backup, supported values are - Register,Unregister,ConfigureProtection,Backup,Restore,StopProtection,DeleteBackupData,CreateProtectionPolicy,DeleteProtectionPolicy,UpdateProtectionPolicy

trans-unit.source: **Level**: Supported values are - Informational, Error.
trans-unit.target: **Level**: Supported values are - Informational, Error.

trans-unit.source: For alerts on failed action use Error and for alerts on successful jobs use Informational.
trans-unit.target: For alerts on failed action use Error and for alerts on successful jobs use Informational.

trans-unit.source: **OperationName**: This will be of the format "Microsoft.Backup/backupvault/
trans-unit.target: **OperationName**: This will be of the format "Microsoft.Backup/backupvault/

trans-unit.source: " where EventName is as described above.
trans-unit.target: " where EventName is as described above.

trans-unit.source: **Status**: Supported values are- Started, Succeeded and Failed.
trans-unit.target: **Status**: Supported values are- Started, Succeeded and Failed.

trans-unit.source: It is advisable to keep Informational as level for Succeeded status.
trans-unit.target: It is advisable to keep Informational as level for Succeeded status.

trans-unit.source: **SubStatus**: Same as status for backup operations
trans-unit.target: **SubStatus**: Same as status for backup operations

trans-unit.source: **RuleType**: Keep it as *Event* as backup alerts are based on events.
trans-unit.target: **RuleType**: Keep it as *Event* as backup alerts are based on events.

trans-unit.source: **ResourceGroup**:ResourceGroup of the resource on which operation is triggered.
trans-unit.target: **ResourceGroup**:ResourceGroup of the resource on which operation is triggered.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain this from ResourceId value.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain this from ResourceId value.

trans-unit.source: Value between fields */resourceGroups/* and */providers/* in ResourceId value is the value for ResourceGroup.
trans-unit.target: Value between fields */resourceGroups/* and */providers/* in ResourceId value is the value for ResourceGroup.

trans-unit.source: **Name**: Name of the Alert Rule.
trans-unit.target: **Name**: Name of the Alert Rule.

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Description of the alert rule.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Description of the alert rule.

trans-unit.source: **CustomEmails**: Specify the custom email address to which you want to send alert notification
trans-unit.target: **CustomEmails**: Specify the custom email address to which you want to send alert notification

trans-unit.source: **SendToServiceOwners**: This option sends alert notification to all administrators and co-administrators of the subscription.
trans-unit.target: **SendToServiceOwners**: This option sends alert notification to all administrators and co-administrators of the subscription.

trans-unit.source: A sample alert mail looks similar to this:
trans-unit.target: A sample alert mail looks similar to this:

trans-unit.source: Sample Header:
trans-unit.target: Sample Header:

trans-unit.source: Alert Header
trans-unit.target: Alert Header

trans-unit.source: Sample body of the alert mail:
trans-unit.target: Sample body of the alert mail:

trans-unit.source: Alert Body
trans-unit.target: Alert Body

trans-unit.source: Limitations on Alerts
trans-unit.target: Limitations on Alerts

trans-unit.source: Event based alerts are subjected to following limitations:
trans-unit.target: Event based alerts are subjected to following limitations:

trans-unit.source: Alerts are triggered on all Virtual machines in the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: Alerts are triggered on all Virtual machines in the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: You cannot customize it to get alerts for specific set of virtual machines in a backup vault.
trans-unit.target: You cannot customize it to get alerts for specific set of virtual machines in a backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Alerts are auto resolved if there is no alert matching event triggered in next alert duration.
trans-unit.target: Alerts are auto resolved if there is no alert matching event triggered in next alert duration.

trans-unit.source: Use *WindowSize* parameter in Add-AlertRule cmdlet to set alert triggering duration.
trans-unit.target: Use *WindowSize* parameter in Add-AlertRule cmdlet to set alert triggering duration.

trans-unit.target: Next steps
